alert.note: Alert for Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 5:43PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Grayson County through 615 PM CDT... At 543 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sherman, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sherman, Whitesboro, Van Alstyne, Howe, Pottsboro, Tom Bean, Knollwood, Dorchester, southern Lake Texoma, Southmayd, Sadler and Luella. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
